name: Vedanta - Wake up! by the backwaters, Fort Kochi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice place to stay and it's in a good area in Fort Cochin. If you're coming from Ernakulam station you should absolutely use the pre-paid taxi booth as a prepaid rickshaw only costs around 140 rupees - rickshaw drivers will charge you anything up to 500 rupees if you go to them directly.
reviews.title: Nice homestay but a bit pricey...

reviews.text: The rooms at this homestay are very clean and the staff are really friendly - they even gave my boyfriend a bunch of flowers for his birthday.
reviews.title: Super value for money place to stay in Cochin !

reviews.text: It takes about 5 mins to walk round to the ferry port which goes to Ernakulam, 20 minutes to walk to Mattancherry and you're less than 2 minutes to the restaurants etc.
reviews.title: Excellent location, don't fork out for a private room though

reviews.text: Fort Cochin is quite expensive compared to the rest of India so we were quite taken aback on our first night there when we read the menu prices. It's also very difficult to find anywhere to drink, there is one pub (which isn't very nice at all) and the Seagull Hotel, both of which are about 5 minutes walk from Vedanta and close at 10pm. Would be good if Vedanta had some beer on sale so that guests can chill out with other travellers in the common areas without having to go and track down a place to buy alcohol which really isn't very easy at all in Kerala!
reviews.title: Average place with little character

reviews.text: I would have given this place 5 starts if it wasn't so expensive for the rooms!
reviews.title: I would recommend

reviews.text: Memorable experience......enough privacy. Also the rooms are so good and its affordable. Unlike other hotels ...staff are so friendly. Another merit is that its in the heart of Kochi.....if getting a chance to visit Kochi I wil only stay in Vedanta......
reviews.title: A wonderful stay in fort Kochi...

reviews.text: Vedanta- Wake up!.. could not be so aptly titled, given its co-incidental location right at the hustle n bustle of fort kochi!.. yet remaining surprisingly quiet as a 50m detour from the main road, takes you to a sanguine and cosy atmosphere...
reviews.title: Wake Up! to Fort kochi...

reviews.text: The Fishing nets. .the bus station.. the boat ferry service ..all in a 5min radius!
reviews.title: Happy home !!

reviews.text: The establishment is a no-frills joint, yet the make-up with the ever so dotting and joyful staff..who are locals of the area.. who are ever so willing to put you into the pulse of Fort Kochi... They have been of great help, and i thank them immensely for it.
reviews.title: Welcoming place to stay

reviews.text: Fort kochi was truly an experience in itself!.. the local demographic flavor ranging from the native keralite,, Muslim and north Indian ( Gujarati) residents.. moving about the Portuguese, dutch and subsequently the British influence of the area... was truly a visual potpourri of a cultural legacy.
reviews.title: home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really liked this place. Very relaxed feel to the place and very friendly staff. The property is right in the middle of all the action in Fort Kochi (especially close o the fishing nets) and yet feels separated from the traffic and noise. The rooms are basic but well air conditioned with clean bathrooms and nice warm showers :-) My wife and I made some lovely friends while we were there and would love to go back again someday. Thank you Vedanta for all the wonderful memories.
reviews.title: Amazing hostel....great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in India we were really warmly welcomed at this hostel by Binu and Djoshi.
reviews.title: Recommended : Vedanta Wake up !

reviews.text: Absolutely clean rooms, perfect location right in the heart of Fort Kochi, great staff, free wifi and a reliable TukTuk-Driver Sajab - what do you need else??
reviews.title: Best possibles introduction to India

reviews.text: We will be back again ! !
reviews.title: Dissatisfied initially, later patched up

reviews.text: Frank and Soula
reviews.title: great hostel at great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hostel based on the previous reviews we read, however, it was extremely disappointing when we arrived, the room was dirty, walls were damp with water leaking from a room above, obviously for some time as mould was growing everywhere, the matress was covered in a old torn duvet cover and we were not given and bed linen, when we asked for a sheet we were given 2 single stained and dirty ones (for a double bed) and the pillows smelt very dirty, the towels provided were not clean either. This place is nothing like the photo's - its in need of a very good clean and some basic maintainance before they can justify asking paying guests to stay. We saw no evidence of the social aspect of the hostel either, the common room was only used by staff and their friends during our stay.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Absolutely great hotel, really clean, staff were friendly. Booking trips was easy and convenient. We were on the doorstep of the fishing nets and a short walk away from two of the kathakali venues. Everything was made easy for us.
reviews.title: Now I know why it's called 'wake up!'

reviews.text: The only criticism I have is that every morning we were awoken by a parade of drums and chanting outside, I think maybe a school is close by which starts the day with some form if drum parade. This woke us up very early every day, which in some way turned out to be a blessing as we had more time to explore kochi, but in other ways was not what we had signed up for. If I'm honest, the staffs friendliness and the other positive aspects of the hotel outweigh this one negative, as the general experience was great.
reviews.title: Good place and friendliest staff ever

reviews.text: I liked the hostel a lot because I met a lot of other backpackers. The dorm rooms are simple but you get all that you need. The bunk beds are comfortable and you have the western style bathroom with hot water in the room. You also have aircon, which is not common in this price category. The place is well located to explore Fort Cochi by foot. Just along the street you will find the theater for traditional dance and the chinese fishing nets. The post office is also close if you want to ship some of your many souvenirs home. The best thing about the place is the staff. I never met such friendly and enthusiastic staff. They always had a smile for you no matter what time it was!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in fort Cochin

reviews.text: Great place, very welcoming and very helpfull, knowledgable about the area and can arrange good tours, I done the backwaters tour and really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: A decent hostel where you'll meet other backpackers

aka: Vedanta - Wake Up! By The Backwaters, Fort Kochi Kochi (Cochin), India - Kerala
description: Vedanta, the highest state of consciousness and self realization can be achieved only while traveling. Vedanta Wake up! India’s finest chain of backpacking hostels, was conceived to address the primary concerns of backpackers and budget travelers. Vedanta Wake up! by the backwaters, Fort Kochi, is nestled in the heart of the city and is walking distance to all shops, restaurants, bars and local attractions such as the beach, Chinese Fishing Nets, Santa Cruz Cathedral, St. Francis Church and Mattancherry Palace. Our rooms are designed keeping comfort and cleanliness in mind. We offer shared rooms with en-suite bathrooms as well as superior private rooms for families. At Vedanta Wake up!, we offer you an environment to meet fellow travelers in our lounges which are fully equipped with computers, free Wi-Fi, television sets, DVD players, movies, book exchange libraries, guitars, board games, maps and eateries. Our eateries will provide you with hygienic and sumptuous meals cooked by our in-house chefs any time of the day at very minimum charge. We encourage our guests to socialize and get to know each other through local bar crawls, sight-seeing trips, dinner outings, movie nights, karaoke nights and other fun activities almost every night (and there’s no curfew!). We provide assistance in arranging local tours and visits to nearby tourist attractions so that our guests can soak in the sights and sounds and have a memorable holiday experience. We also organize classes such as cooking, yoga, Indian classical music and Ayurvedic massages. You can check in any time of the day. Our young and energetic team will provide you with every comfort possible to make your stay fun and unforgettable.
